item.description:
This event is restricted to sea kayaks with bulkheads 14 ft or longer.

Low tide Portsmouth Harbor is at 12:25pm

We will leave Hilton Park at 11:00am, ride the ebb tide out of Portsmouth Harbor and around Newcastle Island. Stop at Odiorne Point for a break while waiting for the tide to turn, and then ride the flood tide back to Hilton Park. Please arrive early for a pre trip discussion of the hazards we will likely encounter.

This is a Level 2+ Trip. You should have strong boat control skills and experience with strong currents. We will be dealing with very strong currents, strong reversing currents, strong eddy currents, and whirlpools. There are hazards from commercial piers, moored commercial vessels, boat traffic and large boat wakes. Outside of the harbor, there will be ocean swell, possible wind and surf. This trip is for Level 2 + kayakers who have experience paddling in tidal areas as well as wet exit & capsize recoveries. Also you must have appropriate safety gear including PFD, Paddle Float & Pump.

Click here for information on Skill Levels

We will reach speeds of up to 12 mph. The total distance will be approximately 18 miles

Directions to Hilton Park:

From 95 North take Exit 4 onto Spaulding Turnpike/Route 16. After crossing the bridge, take 1st exit to the boat ramp.

Hilton Park/rest area is located at Dover Point on Great Bay and the Piscataqua River, adjacent to the General Sullivan Bridge. Playground, picnic areas, free boat launch, and free Parking

Bring a lunch to eat during the trip as well as water and or beverages.

As always, Life vests aka PFDs must be worn at all times while paddling with this group

For safety reasons, this trip is limited to 20 paddlers.

Google Maps Directions to Hilton Park
item.name: Piscataqua River Tidal Paddle - Level 2 +
